decision_conditions: Refused  - To carry out tree surgery including, crown reduce by 3m in height and 1-1.5m from the sides to Two Hornbeams (T5 and T9 on application), crown reduce by 3m in height, Two Oaks (T6 and T7 on application),  to poison One Hornbeam (T4 on application), to fell and poison One Hornbeam (T8 on application) all within Area 1 on TPO 398

Approved - To carry out tree surgery including, a crown reduce to previous points (approximately 1m), One Oak (T1 on application), to Fell One Hornbeams (T4 on application) all within Area 1 on TPO 398

The Oak tree (T1 on application) is situated within the front garden of 43 Copse Wood Way and as a result has a high amenity value. The remaining trees within the application are situated within the rear garden and as a result have a moderate to high group amenity value and significantly contribute to the arboreal character of the Copse Wood Estate (Area of Special Local Character). The trees also contribute to local biodiversity and form part of the area of mature, protected trees that help to provide a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings in the Copsewood Estate and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR). The benefit in amenity and biodiversity afforded by these trees is both present and future because apart from one hornbeam (T4 on application) they have the potential for a long life expectancy.
With regard to the removal and crown reductions of three Hornbeams and two Oaks (T5, T6, T7, T8 and T9 on application). Neither T6 (oak),T7 (oak) or

The tree to be pruned shall be crown reduced by cutting back to 25-50 mm beyond previous points. Crown reduction shall not be construed as 'lopping' or 'topping' and shall result in a tree of typical form for the species and of balanced appearance.
The previous pruning points / pollard heads shall be left intact and an appropriate number of live branches (which can be shortened) shall be left so that a natural-looking crown results.

The works shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained in BS 3998:2010 'Tree work - Recommendations'. Climbing irons or 'spikes' shall not be used during the execution of the work.
In order to protect health of the tree and the visual amenity of the area.
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.  Therefore, if applicable, it is advisable to consult your tree surgeon / consultant to agree an acceptable time for carrying out the approved works.

Expected standard of tree work: The approved works must be carried out in accordance with the conditions laid out above. If they are not, then enforcement action could being taken which could lead to prosecution and heavy fines. Therefore, it is highly recommended that the works are only carried out by a professional and competent arboriculturist who undertakes to comply with the conditions of this consent and in accordance with industry best practice (BS 3998:2010). The Arboricultural Association can provide details of its approved contractors, who have demonstrated such professionalism and competence, on their website (www.trees.org.uk) or by calling 01242 522152. Or on request the Council can provide a list of contractors who are known to carry out tree work to a good standard and to normally maintain an appropriate policy of indemnity insurance.

Refusal of part of the requested works: The applicant retains a right of appeal against the part of the application that has effectively been refused (i.e. To carry out tree surgery including, crown reduce by 3m in height and 1-1.5m from the sides to Two Hornbeams (T5 and T9 on application), crown reduce by 3m in height, Two Oaks (T6 and T7 on application),  to poison One Hornbeam (T4 on application), to fell and poison One Hornbeam (T8 on application) all within Area 1 on TPO 398).
description: To carry out tree surgery including, crown reduce to previous points (approximately 1m), One Oak (T1 on application), crown reduce by 3m in height and 1-1.5m from the sides to Two Hornbeams (T5 and T9 on application), crown reduce by 3m in height, Two Oaks (T6 and T7 on application), to Fell and poison Two Hornbeams (T4 and T8 on application) all within Area 1 on TPO 398
